results.title: Downing of Chinese Spy Balloon Ends Chapter in a Diplomatic Crisis
results.abstract: The balloon, spotted earlier this week over the western United States, was brought down when an F-22 fighter jet fired an air-to-air missile at it off the coast of South Carolina.

results.title: Ozempic Can Cause Major Weight Loss. What Happens if You Stop Taking It?
results.abstract: As more patients turn to diabetes medications for other uses, a shortage has taken hold. But doctors say going off these drugs can take a toll.

results.title: Two Men Arrested in Execution-Style Killings of a Family in California
results.abstract: The brutal nature of the mass shooting, which included the murder of an innocent young mother and her infant, shocked the nation.

media.caption: Noah David Beard was one of two suspects arrested early Friday and charged with killing six members of a family in a small California town last month.

results.adx_keywords: Cold and Cold Spells;National Weather Service;Mount Washington (NH)
results.title: Mount Washington set a record for coldest wind chill ever recorded at minus 108 degrees.
results.abstract: The air temperatures at the region’s highest peak went as low as minus 47 degrees, according to the National Weather Service.

media.caption: Conditions atop Mount Washington, left, were extreme on Saturday.

results.title: An Even Deadlier Pandemic Could Soon Be Here
results.abstract: Bird flu has spread widely among animals. Unless we act now, it soon could do the same among humans.

media.caption: A pelican suspected to have died from H5N1 avian influenza on a beach in Peru in December.

results.title: Gary Glitter Is Released From Prison After Serving Half of His Sentence
results.abstract: The disgraced former glam rock singer was found guilty in 2015 of sexually abusing three young girls in the 1970s. He had been given a 16-year sentence.

media.caption: Paul Gadd, better known by his stage name, Gary Glitter, arrived at court in London in 2015. He has been released after spending eight years in prison.

results.title: Jimmy Kimmel Addresses Netflix’s Plan to Charge for Shared Accounts
results.abstract: “I understand. You don’t like paying for TV,” Kimmel said. “So, let me just say this: My name is Jimmy and I’m free every night, no charge.”

results.abstract: Researchers say the jewelry, found in a field outside Birmingham, England, is an extraordinary piece of treasure.

results.title: Attacks on Electrical Substations Raise Alarm

results.title: Eye Drops Are Recalled After Being Linked to Vision Loss and 1 Death
results.abstract: The maker of EzriCare Artificial Tears said it was recalling the eye drops after U.S. health authorities linked the product to a drug-resistant bacteria strain.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said that the bacteria strain linked to EzriCare Artificial Tears had been found in 55 people in a dozen states as of Tuesday.
media.copyright: Christian Hansen for The New York Times

results.title: ‘One Gut Punch After Another’: The Case of the Missing Dallas Zoo Animals
results.abstract: The brazenness of the thefts brought international attention and a range of whodunit theories. The police charged a 24-year-old local man in connection with the disappearances.

media.caption: Two emperor tamarin monkeys disappeared from the Dallas Zoo. The pair would later be found in a boarded-up home about 15 miles away.

results.byline: By Steve Eder, Matthew Rosenberg, Joseph Goldstein, Mike Baker, Kassie Bracken and Mark Walker
results.title: Muscle Cars, Balaclavas and Fists: How the Scorpions Rolled Through Memphis
results.abstract: Residents say the street crime unit was an intimidating and sometimes violent presence in the city. Five Scorpion officers are charged with murdering Tyre Nichols during an arrest.

media.caption: On Jan. 7, officers pulled Tyre Nichols from his car and kicked and beat the 29-year-old amateur photographer as he begged them to let him go home. He later died at the hospital.

results.title: Jury Rules for Elon Musk and Tesla in Investor Lawsuit Over Tweets

results.title: U.S. Considers Lifting Protections for Grizzly Bears Near Two National Parks
results.abstract: Federal wildlife officials will begin a yearlong study in response to “substantial information” showing that grizzly populations had improved.
